EDITOR'SNOTE DanielSosnoski,editor-in-chief12 CHIROPRACTIC ECONOMICS SEPTEMBER 22, 2015 CHIROECO.COMChiropractic Research (PCCR). "Our goal is to encourage 20,000 chiropractors to give $20 per year in support of chiropractic research at Palmer," said PalmerCollege of Chiropractic Vice Chancellor forResearch and Health Policy Christine Goertz, DC, PhD. "The college hopes to raise approximately $400,000 annually to support pilot studies and train future chiropractic researchers. "When I graduated from chiropractic college 25 years ago, people would often ask 'How doeschiropractic work?' " Goertz added. "T en yearslater, they were more commonly asking 'How well does it work?' and 'How much does it cost?' Now the question I hear most often is, 'How do we find a good chiropractor?' " Foradditionaldetailsabouttheresearch program,visitChiroEco.com/pccr. Source: Palmer College of Chiropractic, palmer.edu D'Youville names new director of chiropractic D'Y ouville College has named Jeffrey S. Ware, DC, executive director of its chiropracticprogram. He had been serving as interim executive director since January. He joined theD'Y ouville chiropractic faculty as an assistantprofessor of clinical sciences in 2013, teachingclinical diagnosis and was clinical compliancecoordinator for the college chiropractic clinics. Previously, he was dean of chiropractic affairs and director of professional development at Logan University (previously Logan College of Chiropractic) in Chesterfield, Missouri. He alsomaintained a private practice. TolearnmoreaboutWare,visit ChiroEco.com/dyc-jsware. Elliott, DC It is with deep sorrow that T exas Chiropractic College (TCC) wishes to inform the community of the death of Shelby M.Elliott, DC, former TCC president and alumnus of the class of1950. Elliott passed away on Wednesday, Aug. 19. Elliottcompleted his doctor of chiropractic degree at T exasChiropractic College and served as president of the institutionupon appointment by the TCC Board of Regents from 1990until his retirement in 2003. As president, Elliott guided the new construction of multiple campus facilities including the Moody Health Centerand Harris Administration Building, while also offering his ownpersonal financial support for early renovations and thelandmark monument at the institution's entrance alongSpencer Highway in Pasadena, T exas. In lieu of flowers, thefamily suggests making donations to T exas ChiropracticCollege or First Baptist Church of Pasadena Building Fund. ToreadaboutElliott'slegacy,visitChiroEco.com/shelbyelliott. Source: Texas Chiropractic College, txchiro.edu ACA statement on NCCIH's new report on pain in the US American Chiropractic Association (ACA) President Anthony Hamm, DC, has released the followingstatement on the National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health's (NCCIH) new analysis of data from the 2012 National Health Interview Survey (NHIS), which found that most Americanadults have experienced some level of pain, from brief to more lasting pain, and from relatively minorto more severe pain: "The American Chiropractic Association is encouraged that NCCIH's research priorities include the study of complementary approaches to pain management, including chiropractic services. Integratedapproaches can offer patients a higher degree of safety and help address opioid overuse and abusein the United States by reducing the necessity for prescription pain medications. NCCIH's analysisfound that chiropractic services remain one of the most popular nondrug approaches, with more than19 million patients having received spinal manipulation in the previous year for pain management." Toreadthefullstatement,visitChiroEco.com/aca-nccih. Source: EndoBalance, endobalance.com Chiropractic BioPhysics wins top honors at the 2015 WFC Research Conference Cairo University and Chiropractic BioPhysics nonprofit recently won top honors at the 2015 Word Federation of Chiropractic (WFC) researchconference in the Best Original Research in the Mediterranean Region category. Boise, Idaho,chiropractor Deed Harrison, DC, was a senior author on this project, titled "Does ImprovementT owards a Normal Sagittal Cervical Configuration Aid in the Management of Lumbosacral Radiculopathy: A Randomized Controlled T rial." The project was led by Ibrahim Mustafa, PT , PhD, and Aliaa Diab, PT , PhD. Harrison won in the Best Original Research category (Mediterranean Region) at the WFC conference this year. "I am ecstatic to have been honored by this prestigious award; I humbly accept this award on behalf of my co-authors and congratulate them for this outstanding achievement," Harrison said. The WFC's 13th Biennial Congress, incorporating the 2015 Annual Convention of the EuropeanChiropractors' Union, was hosted by the HellenicChiropractors' Association in May 2015. Formoreinformationaboutthehonors, visitChiroEco.com/dharrison. Source: Chiropractic Biophysics, idealspine.com Add decompression services a new offering in OnDemand decompression services. Source: MacPractice, macpractice.com H E A L T H N E W S Simple behavior changes can help turn down the volumeon snoring Routinely waking up to a bleary-eyed and resentful sleep partner could be a sign of snoring. Snoring happens when the upper airways narrow, triggering turbulent airflow and a trumpet-like racket. "Snoring is a sign that there is a really narrowed space," says Sanjay Patel, MD, a sleep disorder specialist at Beth Israel DeaconessMedical Center and associate professor of medicine at Harvard Medical School. The key is identifying underlying causes of the narrowing and making changes to counteract them, Patel explains in the August 2015 Harvard Men's Health Watch. Electrodiagnostics EMG Practice Setup Services fromT eleEMG was created by a board certified neurologist to help primarycare providers set up an EMG practice of their own. The comprehensive program starts with hands-ontraining of providers and their staff in various EMG techniques, followed by setting up the EMG lab they need. Call 877-835-3364 or visit teleemg.com. Topicals T opical Pain Reliever from China-Gel is an herbal topical pain-relieving gel developed by a chiropractor. It incorporates modern technology with ancient pain-relieving concepts of T raditional Chinese Medicine.Resembling a hand cream, it spreads on evenly and then absorbscompletely into the skin without staining clothing or leaving a greasy residue. It has a pleasant and soothing lavender-menthol fragrance on application that ultimately becomes odorless as the gel is absorbed. Call 800-898-4435 or visit chinagel.com. Visionhealth ultra Preventive Vision is a comprehensivemultivitamin mineral formula with phytonutrients and carotenoids designed to help support a healthy macula, retina, and visual performance for aging adults affected by excess blue-light exposure and free radical damage. Developed in conjunction withStuart Richer, OD, PhD, a leading expert in eye health, ultra Preventive Vision offers a lutein-to-zeaxanthin ratio of3-to-1, which has been shown in research to contribute to a healthymacula and vision.* Call 800-245-4440 or visit douglaslabs.com.Testingstrips Biotron Generic T est Strips from ScripHessco can test 10-SG glucose, bilirubin, ketone, specific gravity, blood, pH, protein, urobilinogen, nitrite, and leukocytes. There are 100 per package. Call 800-747-3488 or visit scriphessco.com. Instrumentadjusting Activator V from Activator Methods International is marketed as the world's first FDA-registered cordless electronicchiropractic adjusting instrument. Producing thrust at the touch of a button, the Activator V uses a new force wave designed to allow deeper force penetration with no discomfort. It's said to be lightweight, ergonomically designed, wireless, and easy to use. Call 800-598-0224 or visit activator.com. Nervoussystemfunction InSight from Chiropractic Leadership Alliance is an analysis system used for apatient's spine and nerve connections using noninvasive, evidence-based technologies. It has been a trusted technology for more than two decades and is Space Foundation Certified from its use in space programs. It's also been used in more than 40 countries around the world. This accurate and reliable scanning system aims to detect hidden patterns of damaging stress before health issues arise. Call 800-285-2001 or visit subluxation.com. Electrotherapy The InTENSity EX4 is an advanced four-channel multifunction electrotherapy system offering practitioners a wide range of treatment options in one user-friendly, ergonomic design. The unit is equipped with a menu-driven, color touch- screen interface that intuitively groups and displays clinical protocols, guiding clinicians step- by-step to ensure the ideal therapeutic treatment. A few simple key presses are all that is needed to quick-start a treatment. Call 877-341-8367 or visit tensnet.com. *These statements have not been evaluated by the Food and Drug Administration.
